newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH AGM AGREES CZK 500MLN EQUITY RISE.
newsitem.headline: CZECH AGM AGREES CZK 500MLN EQUITY RISE.

text.p: The closely-held Czech bank Pragobanka a.s. on Friday said a annual general meeting of shareholders agreed to raise basic equity through a 500 million crown rights issue priced at a 200 percent premium.
In a statement, bank spokesman Dusan Michelfeit said the premium would raise another one billion crowns, and the new shares would not be publicly traded.
The bank, which is majority-owned by the largest Czech insurer Ceska Pojistovna a.s. , has current basic capital of 1.36 billion crowns.

The bank posted a gross 1995 profit before provisions of 406 million crowns which was all ploughed into reserves. Further additions to reserves accounted created a net loss of 868 million crowns for the year.
Michelfeit said shareholders agreed to cover the loss to reserves from the money gained from the premium on the new share issues, plus premiums gained from previous rights issues.
He said the AGM also agreed to add two representatives of Pojistovna to the bank's current five member management board.
